page.title: 09Lea Hurst
page.content: The estate of Lea Hurst first came into the possesion of the Nightingale family in{1707.}The house known as, 'Lea Hurst' was built by Florence's father. The land covered an area of 640 acres. The house is made of Derbyshire gritstone with a slate slab roof. It is situated in a beautiful area with magnificent views. It remained in the Nightingale family until{1940}when Louis S. Nightingale died. In{1946}it was offered for sale by auction. Prior to the sale the house and land was used as a home for nurses by the executers of the will. The house was given to the Royal Surgical Aid Society in{1951}by the executors of the will of the late Lt. Col. E.S. Halford. Since then it has been used as a home for old people.
